intro: Porroglossum marniae, commonly known as the Marnia's porroglossum, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
